title: 820-3437 Booting and chime, logo crash (but still running)
message:
Hi fellows, I have this 3437 that came in liquid damaged. It was quite dirty so I ultrasoniced it first. Now the mac chimes and boots showing the apple logo. Then a vertical short line appears in the bottom and the apple logo is gone. The mac is still running though, and the backlight is tumed on. Any ideas? Apple ASD test says battery needs replacement but this is a new battery working fine in another Mac. Also got green and orange light on the macsafe. External display is not running.

Have a good weekend!

title: 820-3437 Booting and chime, logo crash (but still running)
message:
[QUOTE="arnonabuurs, post: 38581"]Hi fellows, I have this 3437 that came in liquid damaged. It was quite dirty so I ultrasoniced it first. Now the mac chimes and boots showing the apple logo. Then a vertical short line appears in the bottom and the apple logo is gone. The mac is still running though, and the backlight is tumed on. Any ideas? Apple ASD test says battery needs replacement but this is a new battery working fine in another Mac. Also got green and orange light on the macsafe. External display is not running.

Have a good weekend![/QUOTE]

Where was the corrosion?
You can run the full ASD OS testing but not boot into the OS?

These batt connectors are very susceptible to corrosion underneath. I usually pull back a bit before running through the cleaner and use a brush after. Also, I’ve noticed they can catch debris from the cleaner.
​​​​

title: 820-3437 Booting and chime, logo crash (but still running)
message: Could be anything. All depends on where the corrosion was.
